title: Understanding Fractions
description: A fraction represents a part of a whole. The top number (numerator) tells us how many parts we have, and the bottom number (denominator) tells us how many equal parts the whole is divided into.
learning_objectives: Understand what fractions represent
Identify numerator and denominator
Visualize fractions using pictures and real objects
Recognize fractions in everyday life

visual_elements.description: Interactive circular pie charts that students can divide and shade

real_world_examples: Sharing pizza slices equally among friends
Measuring ingredients for baking (1/2 cup of flour)
Time representation (quarter past, half past)
Money (50 cents is 1/2 of a dollar)

interactive_activities.title: Pizza Party Sharing
interactive_activities.description: Help divide pizzas equally among friends

interactive_activities.title: Fraction Slider
interactive_activities.description: Move the slider to see how fractions change

title: Equivalent Fractions
description: Equivalent fractions are different fractions that represent the same amount. For example, 1/2 = 2/4 = 3/6 because they all represent half of something.
learning_objectives: Recognize that different fractions can represent the same value
Find equivalent fractions by multiplying or dividing
Simplify fractions to their lowest terms
Compare fractions using equivalent forms

visual_elements.description: Side-by-side fraction bars showing equivalent relationships

real_world_examples: Half a chocolate bar = 2 quarters of the same bar
30 minutes = 1/2 hour = 3/6 of an hour
25 cents = 1/4 dollar = 2/8 dollar

interactive_activities.title: Equivalent Fraction Matching
interactive_activities.description: Match fractions that represent the same amount

interactive_activities.title: Build Your Own Equivalents
interactive_activities.description: Create equivalent fractions using visual models

title: Introduction to Algebra
description: Algebra is like a puzzle where some numbers are hidden behind letters. We use letters (like x or n) to represent unknown numbers that we need to find.
learning_objectives: Understand that letters can represent unknown numbers
Solve simple equations with one variable
Use algebra to solve word problems
Balance equations like a see-saw

visual_elements.description: Interactive balance scale showing equation solving

real_world_examples: Finding missing money: 'I had $20, spent some, and have $12 left. How much did I spend?'
Age puzzles: 'Sarah is 3 years older than Tom. If Sarah is 15, how old is Tom?'
Shopping problems: 'Apples cost $2 each. How many can I buy with $10?'

interactive_activities.title: Equation Balance Master
interactive_activities.description: Balance the equation scale by finding the missing number

interactive_activities.title: Number Mystery Box
interactive_activities.description: What number is hiding in the mystery box?

title: Understanding Ratios
description: A ratio compares two or more quantities. It tells us how much of one thing there is compared to another. For example, in a class of 15 boys and 10 girls, the ratio of boys to girls is 15:10 or 3:2.
learning_objectives: Understand what ratios represent
Write ratios in different forms (3:2, 3 to 2, 3/2)
Simplify ratios to their simplest form
Use ratios to solve practical problems
real_world_examples: Recipe ingredients: 2 cups flour to 1 cup water
Paint mixing: 3 parts blue to 1 part yellow makes green
Class composition: 12 girls to 8 boys
Speed comparisons: Car travels 60km while bicycle travels 15km

interactive_activities.title: Perfect Recipe Ratios
interactive_activities.description: Mix ingredients in the correct ratio to make delicious food

interactive_activities.title: Color Creation Lab
interactive_activities.description: Mix colors in different ratios to create new colors

title: Understanding Percentages
description: Percentage means 'out of 100'. It's another way to write fractions and decimals. 50% means 50 out of 100, which is the same as 1/2 or 0.5.
learning_objectives: Understand that percent means 'out of 100'
Convert between percentages, fractions, and decimals
Calculate simple percentages
Recognize percentages in everyday situations
real_world_examples: Test scores: 'You got 85% on your math test'
Sales discounts: '20% off all toys'
Battery level: 'Phone battery is at 30%'
Weather: '80% chance of rain today'

interactive_activities.title: Percentage Grid Artist
interactive_activities.description: Shade the grid to show different percentages

interactive_activities.title: Discount Shopping Spree
interactive_activities.description: Calculate discounts and final prices while shopping

title: Area and Perimeter Fundamentals
description: Perimeter is the distance around the outside of a shape - like walking around a playground. Area is the space inside a shape - like how much grass covers a field.
learning_objectives: Distinguish between area and perimeter
Calculate perimeter by adding all sides
Find area using square units
Apply area and perimeter to real-world problems

visual_elements.description: Draggable shapes with highlighted perimeters and fillable areas

real_world_examples: Fencing a garden: perimeter tells you how much fence you need
Painting a wall: area tells you how much paint you need
Carpet for a room: need to know the floor area
Running track: perimeter is the distance around

interactive_activities.title: Garden Fence Calculator
interactive_activities.description: Help farmers calculate how much fencing they need

interactive_activities.title: Floor Tile Designer
interactive_activities.description: Count how many tiles fit in different room shapes

title: Understanding Volume
description: Volume is the amount of space inside a 3D object. Think of it as how much water you can pour into a container, or how many small cubes can fit inside a box.
learning_objectives: Understand volume as 3D space measurement
Use cubic units to measure volume
Calculate volume of rectangular prisms
Connect volume to real-world containers and spaces

visual_elements.description: Interactive 3D containers that can be filled with unit cubes

real_world_examples: Water bottles: 500ml volume
Moving boxes: how much stuff fits inside
Swimming pools: how much water they hold
Fish tanks: space for fish to swim

interactive_activities.title: Box Packing Challenge
interactive_activities.description: Pack unit cubes into different sized boxes

interactive_activities.title: Container Comparison
interactive_activities.description: Pour water between containers to compare volumes
